{/* Hero Section */}

01

2024

Masters 1st Term Project Location: Chicago, Illinois

Formula One

Grand Prix Race Circuit

Proposal for the next Grand Prix in Chicago features a minimal-intervention race circuit designed with a key concept of year-round multipurpose use. Beyond race week, the track would serve as a versatile space for concerts, running, and public gatherings.

{/* New Section: Image and Description */}

Urban Renewal Strategy Chicago Infrastructure development and budget.

About the Project

This project aims to design a state-of-the-art Formula One Grand Prix Race Circuit located in the heart of Chicago, Illinois. The circuit is crafted to meet international racing standards while embracing the city's vibrant culture.

With a focus on sustainability and user experience, the design integrates green technologies, advanced materials, and innovative engineering practices to create a unique blend of functionality and aesthetics.
